| An elf-lord:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").
* is a [lord to its kind](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD").
* is male.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). |                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [monst.c#line2338](/wiki/Monst.c#line2338 "Monst.c") |

An **elf-lord**, @, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") type of [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") with two weapon attacks and possess [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and the ability to [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").

Eating an elf-lord [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 53% chance of conferring sleep resistance.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The elf-lord has been renamed to the **elf-noble**; male elf-nobles are elf-lords, while female elf-nobles are called **elf-ladies**.

As part of resolving [issue #679](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/issues/679) regarding congruence between non-player monsters and their player counterparts, [commit b6a3d4b](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/b6a3d4b984eb118ddb02f1605d76b1010df76055) makes it so that elf-nobles and other strong elven polyforms are capped at 18 strength as player elves are.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Elf-lords can generate in small groups, and randomly-generated elf-lords are peaceful towards chaotic [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") players and occasionally peaceful towards chaotic [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"). [Woodland-elves](/wiki/Woodland-elves "Woodland-elves"), [Green-elves](/wiki/Green-elves "Green-elves"), and [Grey-elves](/wiki/Grey-elves "Grey-elves") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into elf-lords, and elf-lords can grow up into [Elvenkings](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking").

In addition to normal random generation, elf-lords can also be generated by the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

Elf-lords are eligible for [offensive](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item") and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), and are [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") [elven equipment](/wiki/Elven_item "Elven item") like other elves:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- They have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with either an [elven mithril-coat](/wiki/Elven_mithril-coat "Elven mithril-coat") or an [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak"), and a 1⁄2 chance of generating with an [elven leather helm](/wiki/Elven_leather_helm "Elven leather helm"); if they do not generate with the helm, they have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with [elven boots](/wiki/Elven_boots "Elven boots").

- They have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger").

- They will also generate with one of the following sets of items, with an equal chance of each set:

  - An [elven bow](/wiki/Elven_bow "Elven bow") and set of [elven arrows](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow"), a 1⁄4 chance of an [elven shield](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield") and a 2⁄3 chance of an [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword").
  - An [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword") and a 1⁄2 chance of an elven shield.
  - A 1⁄2 chance of an elven spear and accompanying elven shield.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

An elf will grow up into a elf-noble of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male elf-lord regardless of gender.

## Strategy

Groups of elf-lords can be quite dangerous to a mid-game character: Elf-lords that have a bow and arrows can pepper you with them repeatedly from a distance with their two weapon attacks, and their status as a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") to their kind allows them to [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") the arrows, which can easily rack up significant damage. Furthermore, they may generate with potions of [gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") that they can use to become stronger Elvenkings.

As a monster that can be generated via summon nasties, they are not as dangerous as an Elvenking, but their ability to ignore [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") like most elves makes them more difficult to drive off than other monsters.

## History

The elf-lord first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Some variants adjust monster names so that female counterparts to the elf-lord are properly named and generated.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), elf-lords are replaced by the [lord and lady](/wiki/Lord_\(GruntHack\) "Lord (GruntHack)") [racial monsters](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster"), which can be elven.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), a hostile elf-lord is generated within the fort's main hall on the third map of [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), female elves will grow up into [elf-ladies](/wiki/Elf-lady_\(dNetHack\) "Elf-lady (dNetHack)") rather than elf lords.

An elf-lord is always generated on the level containing the [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the [Mordor Ruins Quest](/wiki/Mordor_Ruins_Quest "Mordor Ruins Quest"). Within the branch:

- The River Ford level has a 3⁄4 chance of generating an elf-lord in the forest on the west side.
- At the west edge of the Elven Forest level, an elf-lord is among the group of elves generated opposite a horde of [Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") and other monsters led by a [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul").

Elf-lords may appear among the court of an Elvenking or [Elvenqueen](/wiki/Elvenqueen_\(dNetHack\) "Elvenqueen (dNetHack)")-ruled [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the monster is known as the **elven noble**, with male nobles called "elven lords" and female nobles called "elven ladies".

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the monster is known as the elven noble, as in SpliceHack.

As in UnNetHack, the third map of Fort Ludios generates a hostile elven noble within the fort's main hall.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the monster is also known as the elven noble, as in SpliceHack and EvilHack.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 222](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L222): *Default equipment for elves*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Elf-lord

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ elf-lord
Difficulty 11
Attacks Weapon 2d4, weapon 2d4
@ elf-lord
Difficulty 11
Attacks

Weapon 2d4, weapon 2d4

Base level 8
Base experience 123
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 20
Alignment -9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 800
Nutritional value 350
Size Medium
Resistances Sleep
Resistances conveyed Sleep (53%)

An elf-lord:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is an elf.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is male.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.
Reference monst.c#line2338

An elf-lord, @, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. They are a strong type of elves with two weapon attacks and possess sleep resistance, infravision and the ability to see invisible.

Eating an elf-lord corpse or tin has a 53% chance of conferring sleep resistance.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The elf-lord has been renamed to the elf-noble; male elf-nobles are elf-lords, while female elf-nobles are called elf-ladies.

As part of resolving issue #679 regarding congruence between non-player monsters and their player counterparts, commit b6a3d4b makes it so that elf-nobles and other strong elven polyforms are capped at 18 strength as player elves are.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 GruntHack
    • 4.2 UnNetHack
    • 4.3 dNetHack
    • 4.4 SpliceHack
    • 4.5 EvilHack
    • 4.6 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Generation

Elf-lords can generate in small groups, and randomly-generated elf-lords are peaceful towards chaotic elven players and occasionally peaceful towards chaotic humans. Woodland-elves, Green-elves, and Grey-elves can grow up into elf-lords, and elf-lords can grow up into Elvenkings.

In addition to normal random generation, elf-lords can also be generated by the summon nasties monster spell.

Elf-lords are eligible for offensive, defensive and miscellaneous items, and are generated with elven equipment like other elves:[1]

  • They have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with either an elven mithril-coat or an elven cloak, and a 1⁄2 chance of generating with an elven leather helm; if they do not generate with the helm, they have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with elven boots.
  • They have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with an elven dagger.
  • They will also generate with one of the following sets of items, with an equal chance of each set:
    • An elven bow and set of elven arrows, a 1⁄4 chance of an elven shield and a 2⁄3 chance of an elven short sword.
    • An elven broadsword and a 1⁄2 chance of an elven shield.
    • A 1⁄2 chance of an elven spear and accompanying elven shield.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

An elf will grow up into a elf-noble of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male elf-lord regardless of gender.

Strategy

Groups of elf-lords can be quite dangerous to a mid-game character: Elf-lords that have a bow and arrows can pepper you with them repeatedly from a distance with their two weapon attacks, and their status as a lord to their kind allows them to multishot the arrows, which can easily rack up significant damage. Furthermore, they may generate with potions of gain level that they can use to become stronger Elvenkings.

As a monster that can be generated via summon nasties, they are not as dangerous as an Elvenking, but their ability to ignore Elbereth like most elves makes them more difficult to drive off than other monsters.

History

The elf-lord first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

Some variants adjust monster names so that female counterparts to the elf-lord are properly named and generated.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, elf-lords are replaced by the lord and lady racial monsters, which can be elven.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, a hostile elf-lord is generated within the fort's main hall on the third map of Fort Ludios.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, female elves will grow up into elf-ladies rather than elf lords.

An elf-lord is always generated on the level containing the magic portal to the Mordor Ruins Quest. Within the branch:

  • The River Ford level has a 3⁄4 chance of generating an elf-lord in the forest on the west side.
  • At the west edge of the Elven Forest level, an elf-lord is among the group of elves generated opposite a horde of Mordor orcs and other monsters led by a Nazgul.

Elf-lords may appear among the court of an Elvenking or Elvenqueen-ruled throne room.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, the monster is known as the elven noble, with male nobles called "elven lords" and female nobles called "elven ladies".

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the monster is known as the elven noble, as in SpliceHack.

As in UnNetHack, the third map of Fort Ludios generates a hostile elven noble within the fort's main hall.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, the monster is also known as the elven noble, as in SpliceHack and EvilHack.

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 222: Default equipment for elves

An '''elf-lord''', {{monsym|elf-lord}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. They are a [[strong]] type of [[Elf (monster attribute)|elves]] with two weapon attacks and possess [[sleep resistance]], [[infravision]] and the ability to [[see invisible]].

Eating an elf-lord [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a 53% chance of conferring sleep resistance.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|The elf-lord has been renamed to the '''elf-noble'''; male elf-nobles are elf-lords, while female elf-nobles are called '''elf-ladies'''.

As part of resolving [https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/issues/679 issue #679] regarding congruence between non-player monsters and their player counterparts, {{commit|b6a3d4b984eb118ddb02f1605d76b1010df76055|commit b6a3d4b}} makes it so that elf-nobles and other strong elven polyforms are capped at 18 strength as player elves are.}}

==Generation==
Elf-lords can generate in small groups, and randomly-generated elf-lords are peaceful towards chaotic [[Elf (starting race)|elven]] players and occasionally peaceful towards chaotic [[Human (starting race)|humans]]. [[Woodland-elves]], [[Green-elves]], and [[Grey-elves]] can [[grow up]] into elf-lords, and elf-lords can grow up into [[Elvenking]]s.

In addition to normal random generation, elf-lords can also be generated by the [[summon nasties]] [[monster spell]].

Elf-lords are eligible for [[offensive item|offensive]], [[defensive item|defensive]] and [[miscellaneous item]]s, and are [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] [[Elven item|elven equipment]] like other elves:{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|222|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Default equipment for elves}}

* They have a {{frac|2}} chance of generating with either an [[elven mithril-coat]] or an [[elven cloak]], and a {{frac|2}} chance of generating with an [[elven leather helm]]; if they do not generate with the helm, they have a {{frac|4}} chance of generating with [[elven boots]].
* They have a {{frac|2}} chance of generating with an [[elven dagger]].
* They will also generate with one of the following sets of items, with an equal chance of each set:
** An [[elven bow]] and set of [[elven arrow]]s, a {{frac|4}} chance of an [[elven shield]] and a {{frac|2|3}} chance of an [[elven short sword]].
** An [[elven broadsword]] and a {{frac|2}} chance of an elven shield.
** A {{frac|2}} chance of an elven spear and accompanying elven shield.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|An elf will grow up into a elf-noble of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male elf-lord regardless of gender.}}

==Strategy==
Groups of elf-lords can be quite dangerous to a mid-game character: Elf-lords that have a bow and arrows can pepper you with them repeatedly from a distance with their two weapon attacks, and their status as a [[M2_LORD|lord]] to their kind allows them to [[multishot]] the arrows, which can easily rack up significant damage. Furthermore, they may generate with potions of {{! of|gain level}} that they can use to become stronger Elvenkings.

As a monster that can be generated via summon nasties, they are not as dangerous as an Elvenking, but their ability to ignore [[Elbereth]] like most elves makes them more difficult to drive off than other monsters.

==History==
The elf-lord first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
Some variants adjust monster names so that female counterparts to the elf-lord are properly named and generated.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], elf-lords are replaced by the [[Lord (GruntHack)|lord and lady]] [[racial monster]]s, which can be elven.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], a hostile elf-lord is generated within the fort's main hall on the third map of [[Fort Ludios]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], female elves will grow up into [[Elf-lady (dNetHack)|elf-ladies]] rather than elf lords.

An elf-lord is always generated on the level containing the [[magic portal]] to the [[Mordor Ruins Quest]]. Within the branch:

* The River Ford level has a {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating an elf-lord in the forest on the west side.
* At the west edge of the Elven Forest level, an elf-lord is among the group of elves generated opposite a horde of [[Mordor orc]]s and other monsters led by a [[Nazgul]].

Elf-lords may appear among the court of an Elvenking or [[Elvenqueen (dNetHack)|Elvenqueen]]-ruled [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]].

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], the monster is known as the '''elven noble''', with male nobles called "elven lords" and female nobles called "elven ladies".

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the monster is known as the elven noble, as in SpliceHack.

As in UnNetHack, the third map of Fort Ludios generates a hostile elven noble within the fort's main hall.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], the monster is also known as the elven noble, as in SpliceHack and EvilHack.
